abstracts.cdata!:
The project will help achieve a better
            balance between road transport and coastal shipping,
            overcome the isolation of outlying areas and foster regional
            economic activity. The project includes: (i) Road and Bridge
            Component: reconstruction or upgrading of five road sections
            in the Northern Plain totalling about 54 km and of about 13
            km in the Southwest; construction of new bridges to replace
            the Hyppolite and Trois Rivieres bridges, and preinvestment
            studies of high priority projects in the transport sector.
            (ii) Coastal Shipping Ports Component: construction of
            coastal shipping port facilities at Port-au-Prince, Jeremie
            and Port-de-Paix. The project would also include 485
            man/months of technical assistance for design work,
            supervision of construction, management advisory services
            and studies. The project would benefit about 900,000
            persons, mostly low-income rural inhabitants.
